lead_paragraph: The N.H.L.’s salary cap is on the rise again. The league and the players association announced Thursday that each team will have a maximum of $56.7 million to spend for the 2008-9 season — up $6.4 million from last season. The most money a player can earn in a new contract next season is $11.34 million a year.
